document.title: Genome-Wide Detection of Alternative Splicing in Expressed Sequences Using Partial Order Multiple Sequence Alignment Graphs
document.abstract: this paper we present a detailed examination of the technical problems we have encountered in undertaking high-throughput analyses of alternative splicing over the last four years, and the specific solutions we have developed for these problems, in seeking to minimize both false positive and false negative errors
